main event: A radar report from Hokkaido, Japan indicating a possible explosion due to unidentified objects detected over the Sea of Japan on February 19, 1958.
interesting points: The radar showed rapidly moving objects that covered an area of approximately 15 miles,The phenomenon was connected to a nuclear explosion from Matsushiro possibly linked to local fishermen,The sighting involved a length of 2 hours and centered around ground-radar observations,There was a previous report of luminous objects by the Hokkaido Coast Safety Board,The report indicated the existence of unknown radar targets detected at a US radar site in Japan.
witness description: US radar operators and local fishermen
